todo.title: Todo
todo.description:
A simple web application helps users stay organized and managed by adding their tasks to lists.
In this application, the user can check all of the items on the list and create, delete, and make each to-do item to the 'completed' state.

Also, user can access this application not only on their local computer but also everywhere that have an internet connection by using user authentication.
todo.learned:
- Developing CRUD operation with the API server with MongoDB
- Hosting the back-end (server) side and connecting it with the front-end(client) side
- Styling advanced UI/UX with JSX(using a conditional operator) and CSS (using root, hover..)
- Setting authentication with a json web token

emp.title: Employee Time Tracker
emp.description:
A web application that records employees' working time stamps from start to finish, and allows the manager to access all information.

In this application, there are 2 main roles, employee and manager. All workers can record their working hours by clicking the 'record' button and will be calculated their working hours based on starting to finishing work on the main page. On the 'My Employee' page, a manager can check not only all employees' information for working hours, but also update their salary and specific position.
(For conveniently demonstrating this app, the timer will be counted as minutely not hourly)

Test account
Email : employee1@sptech.com
Password : password

Project Database Diagram
emp.learned:
- Structuring of Relational Database Management System (RDBMS) and entity for a database using MySQL
- Implementing Controller for all features integrating with Restful API
- Setting the authentication to log in and permission for a manager page

hotauc.title: HotAuc Action
hotauc.description: HotAuc is a web application where Hot Wheels collectors can buy and sell cars over auctions. Moreover, the application allows buyers to pay for a winning bid over Paypal, sellers to check their earnings and administrators to edit information.
hotauc.contribution:
- Implemented a user interface for results of the payment based on returned data from Payment API (PayPal)
- Showed the users’ selling/ buying information (total earnings, each information of items..), which is stored on MongoDB
- Designed UX/UI of user dashboard frame
hotauc.learned:
- Understanding React.js and MongoDB (module, schema, api..)
- Communicating with team (8) members and Reporting my worked tasks during the meeting
- Reading and understanding other team members's code

serveymaker.title: Super Survey Maker
serveymaker.description:
A web application where users can create their own surveys and manage the surveys.

A logged-in user is able to create a survey based on the survey template. All of the surveys will show on the ‘List of surveys’ page. Through the ‘My Survey’ page, the user can check the user’s survey and edit/delete the survey.
serveymaker.contribution:
- Designed UX/UI for all web pages as a Web Designer
- Documented an External Design Document (Style Guide) which is included wireframes for each page, color swatches, mockups, navigation schematic, and so on
serveymaker.learned:
- Understanding styling for HTML and CSS
- Communicating with team members and Reporting my worked tasks during the meeting

urqr.title: URQR
urqr.skill: MongoDB, Express, React, Node.js, AWS, HTML/CSS
urqr.description:
A web/mobile application that generates a QR code with child information for an emergency card.
URQR offers a QR(Quick Response) code for your child! In this QR code, it is included contact information so that can check the child’s protector. With a smartphone camera, you can scan the QR code easily and it would lead to your child’s information page.

Currently, it is continuing to develop to provide various useful data types, which is an image, voice recordings, and so forth!

[v1.0] - SEPTEMBER 30
• You can generate a QR code with personal information(Name, BirthDate, Phone number, School Info, Special Info, and password)
• Able to check the QR code information by scanning the QR code with a phone camera
: You can also check through URQR URL 'https://sptech-urqr.herokuapp.com/search/YOUR_QRCODE'
• Edit/Update QR Info through password

[v2.0] - OCTOBER 16
• Able to put an image to help identify your kid in a card information
• Designed an user interface for mobile version

[v3.0] - OCTOBER 26
• Designed UX/UI for searching a card page
• Able to delete an QR information card
urqr.learned:
- Using an external library (react-qr-code)
- How a QR code is generated and works
- Using the async/await function and the concept
- The concept of 'App Sleeping' on Heroku
